result.execSummary:
Michael E. Pardo was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael E. Pardo was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael E. Pardo

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF353 and 14CF459 called: 8:57am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Suzanne O'Neill

State has in its possession both warrants from each state of WI and TX - ATty O'Neill also has opies of those documents.

State moves to dismiss 14CF459 w/out prejudice - COURT gants

COURT enters order for defendant to be returned to Texas pursuant to governors' warrant in 14CF343; Defendant to be transportated back to Texas; Bond posted maybe returned to surety immediately.
Review hearing on June 18, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF353 and 14CF459 called: 8:23pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder for K.Mayo; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Suzanne O'Neill
(Hearing re: Modification of Bond)

Atty O'Neill does not object to modify bond in both cases - it was their understanding that the bond was already addressed last week; However requesting cash bond on 353 and signature bond in 459.
State moves to dismiss Ct. 1 in 14CF459 - COURT grants

COURT orders:
14CF459 - $200 sign bond, no driving without valid DL
14CF353 - $10,000 cash bond

Adj: 8:28am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF353 and 14CF459 called: 1:38pm
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Defendant appears in person/in custody/with Atty Suzanne O'Neill (on 14CF353 file only)
(Set for Review of Extradition request)

State notes State of WI has received warrant from State of Texas and will be here in Marathon County within one week.
Poster of $500 cash in 14CF353  file may be returned to the poster
State requests additional 30 day extension - Atty O'Neill objects to extension; Defendant makes statement regarding returning to Texas.
COURT grants extension for 30 days.

COURT resets Review Hearing 6/18/14 at 8:45am

dft
Review Hearing
insufficient adderss; unable to forward
AMENDED.  Defendant to report to Texas forthwith.
Review hearing on June 9, 2014 at 01:25 pm.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:23am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Suzanne O'Neill
(Hearing on Extradition)

State requests additional 60 days for extradition paperwork; 36th Judicial District of Texas has filed necessary paperwork for governor's warrant, and are awaiting that warrant.

Atty O'Neill requests bond modification to release defendant from incarceration and $500 cash be bond; Defendant would post the $500 cash and then return to Texas himself, under his own accord.

COURT questions State re: charges out of TX and if any court appearances missed in Marathon County; State answers.

COURT amends to $500 cash bond - to be set for hearing within 30 days; If further extention is necessary/allowable, State will file necessary paperwork.
Defendant notes he will post that $500 cash bond and report to Texas forthwith.

Adj: 8:31am
